meanings.definition: Weimaraners: a breed of large, short-haired hunting dog originally developed in Germany.
meanings.sent1: Weimaraners are known for their sleek appearance and hunting skills.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor owns two Weimaraners who love to play fetch in the park.
meanings.sent3: The Weimaraners at the dog show were so well-behaved, they stole the spotlight!
meanings.sent4: The Weimaraners moved through the forest like shadows, their keen senses alert.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the Weimaraners' silhouettes against the horizon were majestic.

meanings.definition: Weimaraners: plural form of Weimaraner, referring to more than one dog of this breed.
meanings.sent1: We saw a group of Weimaraners at the dog park, all running and playing together.
meanings.sent2: The breeder specializes in raising Weimaraners for families looking for loyal companions.
meanings.sent3: At the pet store, the Weimaraners' playful antics had everyone smiling.
meanings.sent4: The field was filled with Weimaraners, a sea of silver-gray fur in motion.
meanings.sent5: The Weimaraners' barks echoed through the valley, a chorus of canine voices.
